Key Match Events: The Mets lost 6-0 to the Brewers at American Family Field.
The Mets managed just two hits against six Brewers pitchers.
Jose Quintana's scoreless streak ended at 25 2/3 innings.
Joey Ortiz hit a two-run single in the fourth inning for the Brewers.
Willy Adames delivered an RBI single in the eighth inning.
Andruw Monasterio brought in two additional runs with a single against Danny Young.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the need for the Mets to win and play better.
Pete Alonso acknowledged the team's poor offensive performance and praised the Brewers' pitching.
Jose Quintana highlighted the difficulty of winning and the need for the team to win a ballgame.
Brandon Nimmo praised the Brewers' bullpen and acknowledged the challenge of making the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers are locked into the No. 3 seed for the postseason.
The Mets fell to 0-5 this season against the Brewers.
